skillTree.localised_description: Vladimir Stormbringer's battle-tested warhorse

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
Long has peace in the Old World been bought with the blood of Kislev. When Ruination descends, none are more ready to meet it than the hardy guardians of the north.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summoned unit has increased melee attack and melee defence
Summoned unit has greatly increased melee attack and melee defence

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: There are any number of mysterious wonders secreted away in the shadows, for those discerning enough to find them.

skillTree.localised_description: There is much to be learned from one's neighbours, especially if they fail to shroud their discoveries from prying eyes.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%

skillTree.localised_description: "Show no mercy for the enemies of Kislev, for they will show no mercy to you!"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: This kind of spell is nothing to the Vladimir

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "Ice Sheet"

skillTree.localised_description: Deadliest tip arrow can ever have

	(Hero's army)

Armour-piercing missile damage: +4 for Kislev units
	(Hero's army)

Armour-piercing missile damage: +6 for Kislev units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Vladimir Stormbringer can harness the power of blizzards to enhance the speed of his troops. With a wave of his hand, he summons a freezing storm that swirls around his army, reducing the drag on their movements and allowing them to cover ground with ease. The biting winds of the blizzard invigorate the troops, filling them with an icy determination to reach their destination quickly. With this skill, Vladimir's troops can move at a rapid pace, cutting through snowdrifts and icy terrain to outflank their enemies and seize key positions.
Vladimir creates a shield of wind and lightning that deflects blows and stuns foes who try to breach it. This skill allows Vladimir and his troops to weather savage attacks and regroup.

effects.description:

	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Kislev units

skillTree.localised_description: Vladimir channels the power of the storm to shorten his spell cooldown time, allowing him to cast his spells more frequently to harness the enemy
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.
